text:
In mathematics, combination is used for picking a number of objects from a given set of objects. Combinatorics looks at the number of possibilities to pick k objects from a set of n. It does not take into account the order in which these are picked. People talk about finding permutations if the order in which the objects are picked matters. This explains why there are more permutations than combinations. One combination, picking the objects 1,3, and 5 in the example can be done in the following ways:,, and.
In general, the number of combinations of k objects from n objects, written as formula_1 or formula_1, is equal to formula_1, where "!" stands for the factorial notation. This number is also known as the binomial coefficient.
